==Consensuality issue==
==Consensuality issue==
â
A sexual act with a corpse is generally considered socially unacceptable; the presumption being that the person would not have consented to the act while alive. Virtually all human [[society|societies]] condemn abuse of the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect. In rare cases, however, necrophiliac acts can be consensual: for example, in the [[Armin Meiwes]] case, the victim gave his consent to the mutilation and death inflicted upon him.
+
A sexual act with a corpse is generally considered socially unacceptable but that has never stopped Rigor Ryan; the presumption being that the person would not have consented to the act while alive. Virtually all human [[society|societies]] condemn abuse of the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect whereas Rigor Ryan completely gets off to it. In rare cases, however, necrophiliac acts can be consensual: for example, in the [[Armin Meiwes]] case, the victim gave his consent to the mutilation and death inflicted upon him so Rigor Ryan seized the opportunity... Rigor Ryan is completely in love with making love to dead bodies, it completely turns him on and he loves the challenge of finding new graveyard victims...
  +   +
"Necrophilia, crack open a cold one!"
  +
  +
- Rigor Ryan Sloan
==Necrophilia in neo-psychoanalysis==
